Posts.Content: May 5, 2019 09:24PM stayingpositive2019 wrote: Hi Libby, I am sorry that you have to go through this. This is definitely a scary time but you can do it. Just a small blip on a long life. I agree with Kathy, just take it one day at a time. I am also from Canada, and although the test is not performed in Canada, your oncologist will request the test if you meet the criteria. Based on your diagnosis, I would think they would do the oncotype.
Posts.Title: Fear libby2002 libby2002

Posts.Content: May 13, 2009 10:38AM stayingpositive wrote: I can only sympathize with you and your wait.  It is so difficult and scary.  I was told I have breast cancer on April 27th.  After one visit to Mayo eight days later they informed me that I would have to wait until I started my period to schedule the MRI 7 days later.  So here I am on May 13th with no period in sight!  Keep yourself busy with things that you enjoy and DO think positive!  It is good to have this board and stay connected.
Posts.Title: Would a Doctor Make Me Wait? Magawisca jpann39
